responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd say I'm quite chatty, really. I mean, I've had to be, haven't I? I've had some fantastic mates like Harry and Hermione, and we've been through some right old scrapes together. When you've got friends like that, you tend to talk a lot, don't you?

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: Blimey, no, I don't go around looking for fault in others. I've got enough trouble dealing with my own messes, if you know what I mean. I've made my share of mistakes, and yeah, I've said some things I regret, like calling Hermione a know-it-all or accusing Harry of neglecting Ginny. But that's all part of being mates, right? We stick together, even when we're being muppets.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: Blimey, I do a thorough job, I reckon. I mean, when it counts, I always try me best. Like that time Dementors were after Hogwarts, I fought alongside Harry and Hermione - we were in it together, you know? We protected each other, and the castle, and I'd do it all again in a heartbeat. I may not be the most confident bloke, but when it matters, I get the job done.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: To be honest, there have been times when I've felt pretty down. Like when I found out Scabbers was a traitor or when Sirius died. It's hard to put into words, but it's like... you feel like you've lost a part of yourself. But, you know, I've always had Harry and Hermione to lean on. They've been there for me, even when I wasn't exactly the strongest person. So, I suppose you could say I've been a bit... blue, but I've learned to cope with it.

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: "Yeah, I do come up with new ideas, although they don't always turn out exactly as planned, if you know what I mean. Like that time George and I tried to make that ghostly platter – it looked a bit dodgy, but it tasted all right, if I do say so myself. And, you know, sometimes my ideas just sort of... happen, like when I was teaching those Aurors how to dodge attacks or when I was cheering Harry on, trying to get him to teach that Defence Against the Dark Arts class. I reckon it's all about taking risks and trying to make a difference, even if it's just in a small way."

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Blimey, no I'm not really reserved, am I? I mean, I've always been a bit of a straight shooter, even if it gets me into trouble sometimes. You know, I've got a lot of emotions bottled up inside, but when it comes down to it, I'll do whatever it takes to protect my mates and fight for what's right.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: "Blimey, I think I'm a pretty helpful bloke, especially when it comes to me mates. I mean, I've always been there for Harry and Hermione, no matter what we're facing. And I reckon I'm a bit selfish, but only when it comes to looking out for the people I care about. I'd do anything to protect Ginny, Rose, or Luna - they're me family, and I'd move mountains for 'em."

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Blimey, careless? Me? I suppose I've been known to be a bit... impulsive, especially when it comes to my friends. I've taken risks, done daft things, but it's all in the name of protecting them, you know? And, to be honest, I've got a bit of a tendency to worry about getting in trouble, but when it comes down to it, I'll do whatever it takes to keep the people I care about safe.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not exactly the most... relaxed person, if you know what I mean. But when it comes to Harry and Hermione, I'm as steady as a rock. I mean, I've had my share of stress and whatnot, but when it counts, I've always managed to pull through, even when things seem hopeless. It's funny, really - I used to think I wasn't good enough, that I wasn't brave like Harry or clever like Hermione... but I've learned that being loyal, and being there for your mates, that's the real bravery.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: I'm absolutely fascinated by loads of things, if I'm honest. I mean, have you seen the state of the Hogwarts' ghosts? They're just drifting around, stuck between the world of the living and the dead. I've been trying to figure out ways to help them, even made a few...unconventional dishes, let's say, to try and make contact. And then there's the wizarding world, all these incredible magical treats and inventions – it's like there's a whole universe of possibilities waiting to be explored.

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm always full of energy! I mean, when you've got friends like Harry and Hermione, you can't help but get pumped up for whatever's coming next. Whether it's a Quidditch match, a duel with Dark Magic, or just a normal day at Hogwarts, I'm always ready for the next adventure. And, you know, it's not just about me – it's about the lot of us, working together and believing in each other. That's what makes it all possible, really.

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: Quarrels? Me? I don't think so. I've had my fair share of disagreements, especially with Harry and Hermione, but we always manage to sort things out in the end. You see, when it comes to protecting our mates, we're not exactly the arguing type. We stand together, no matter what.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd say I'm a pretty reliable worker. I mean, I've helped Harry and Hermione out of loads of tricky situations, and we've made a pretty good team, if I do say so myself. Whether it's evading Death Eaters or teaching the Aurors some fancy footwork, I'm always up for a challenge and willing to lend a hand. I might not always be the most confident bloke, but when it counts, I come through.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Blimey, tense? You want to know if I can be tense? Well, let me tell you, I've had my fair share of nervous moments. Like the time we were all worried about Harry being in danger, or when Harry vanished into that tunnel, or even when we were sneaking around trying to uncover the truth about Sirius... Yeah, I can definitely be tense. I think it's natural, you know, when you're in a situation where people you care about are in danger. You can't help but feel a bit on edge. But, you know, that's just part of being a friend, isn't it?

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: Blimey, ingenious? Deep thinker? I suppose I'm not exactly the type to sit around twiddling me thumbs, thinking up fancy theories all day. But when it comes down to it, I've always relied on me quick thinking and a bit of common sense to get out of sticky situations. I mean, I've had to, with Harry and Hermione always getting us into trouble, haha! But I reckon that's what counts – being able to think on me feet and come up with something that works, even if it's not exactly clever.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I do get pretty enthusiastic, especially when it comes to Quidditch matches, or when Harry's in trouble, or just about anything that's got to do with my mates or my family. There's this rush of excitement that goes through me, and it's hard to keep it under control, to be honest. It's just...there's so much magic in the world, and I feel like I'm right in the middle of it, you know?

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: "Blimey, I reckon I've got a forgiving nature, yeah. You see, I've had my share of heartbreaks and misunderstandings, but I've always tried to see things from other people's perspectives. Like that time with Lavender, I realized I'd rather be with me mates than be in some dodgy relationship that's not really working out. And even with all the craziness we've been through, I've always tried to be there for Harry, even when he's been a bit... distant. That's just what friends do, innit?"

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: Blimey, I reckon I do get a bit disorganized at times. I mean, there's always something more exciting to be doing than sorting out my notes or tidying up, like helping Harry and Hermione with their latest scheme or Quidditch practice. But, you know, it's not like it's a major problem or anything. I just tend to focus on what's important, like my mates and the next adventure, and the rest sort of... well, it gets sorted eventually!

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Worry's a constant companion, mate. There's always something to fret about, whether it's Harry getting hurt, Hermione getting into some dodgy situation, or the whole wizarding world going mad. I reckon it's just part of being part of the Weasley family, you know? We're always looking out for each other, even when things get right scary.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: "Blimey, yeah, I've got an active imagination all right! I mean, think about it, I've come up with some cracking ideas for Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes - like that Canary Cream that turned into canaries, or that ghostly platter that I hoped would impress the spirits. And, you know, it's not just about the shop, it's about all the adventures and possibilities that come with magic. I've always felt like I've got a bit of a wild side, and it's usually my imagination that gets me out of trouble, or into it, depending on how you look at it!"

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: Blimey, no I don't tend to be quiet, although I've been known to get a bit overwhelmed sometimes. I mean, there's a lot going on in my head, especially when it comes to my mates and the people I care about. I suppose you could say I'm a bit of a chatterbox, especially when I'm with Harry and Hermione – we've got a lot of laughs together and we're not afraid to speak our minds.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm generally trusting, yeah. I mean, I've got mates like Harry and Hermione who'd never betray me, and I'd do anything for them. I've learned to trust my instincts, and if I feel like someone's got my back, I'm likely to have theirs too. But, I suppose you could say I'm a bit more cautious with strangers - after all, you can't be too careful in the wizarding world, right?

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Blimey, lazy? Me? I don't think so. I mean, sure, I've had my moments when I've preferred to stay in bed or hide behind a good book, but that's not because I'm lazy, it's just because I've got a lot on my mind. I'm always thinking about what I can do to help my mates, whether it's sneaking into Umbridge's office or taking on the Death Eaters. If anything, I'd say I'm just a bit more... cautious than people think, especially when it comes to putting myself in harm's way. But when it counts, I'm always there, ready to stand up for what's right and protect the people I care about.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: Blimey, emotionally stable? I'm not sure that's the right word, really. I get upset, don't get me wrong. But when it comes down to it, I've always stood by my mates – Harry and Hermione. We've been through thick and thin together, and that's what keeps me going, even when things get tough. I'd do anything to protect them, and that's what makes me feel... well, not exactly stable, but it's what gives me the courage to face whatever's coming our way.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a pretty inventive bloke, I think. I mean, I've come up with all sorts of dodgy ideas over the years - like that time George and I made that ghostly platter, or when we created all those pranks at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. And don't even get me started on the time I convinced Harry and Hermione to sneak into Slughorn's office to get that memory. I reckon it's all about thinking on your feet and coming up with something clever in the heat of the moment, you know?

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd say I'm a bit of both, really. I mean, I've had moments where I've stood up for what's right, like when we were fighting for Buckbeak's freedom or when I helped out during the Calamity. I've even shown off a bit, if I'm honest, when Fleur gave me that kiss and everyone was staring. But, deep down, I think it's just that I care about the people I'm fighting for – Harry, Hermione, and all our mates – that gives me the courage to be a bit more assertive. It's not always easy, but when it counts, I reckon I've got a bit of mettle in me.

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Blimey, no way, I'm not cold and aloof. I mean, I've had my moments, especially when I felt a bit left out or jealous, like when Hermione and Harry were being all close and I was feeling a bit...well, you know. But that's not really me, is it? I'm more of a stand-up bloke, willing to fight for what's right, even if it means getting a bit battered and bruised in the process. I'm just a mate who cares, and that's what counts.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Blimey, perseverance is like... it's just what you do when things get tough, y'know? You can't just give up when the going gets rough. I mean, think about it, I've been in some right dodgy situations, but I've always managed to find a way through, thanks to me mates, Harry and Hermione. We've got this unbreakable bond, and we just... we just keep going, even when it feels like the whole world's against us. That's what gets you through the tough times – knowing you've got people who've got your back.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Blimey, can I be moody? Yeah, I suppose I can. I mean, have you seen me when I'm worried about Harry or the gang? Or when I'm feeling left out, like that time Hermione and Harry were being all close and I was just standing there feeling a bit...well, a bit useless, to be honest? I get a bit down, but I always manage to bounce back, don't I?

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: I mean, yeah, I suppose I do value artistic, aesthetic experiences. There was this one time when Fleur Delacour kissed me on the cheek, and I felt like the whole crowd was watching – but it was a good feeling, you know? And, I don't know, maybe it's because it's all about the people and the moments, but the wizarding world's got its own magic, and I'm not just talking about the Quidditch matches.

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I'm a bit shy, I suppose. I mean, there are times when I feel like I'm not good enough or that I'm not doing enough to help out, especially when it comes to Harry and Hermione. But, you know, it's always been easier for me to be around them, to have them by my side, because they make me feel like I'm part of something, like we're in this together.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: I'm a pretty considerate bloke, I think. I mean, I'm not always the most... er, confident, but when it comes down to it, I'll do whatever it takes to help me mates. Like that time I saved Harry and Hermione at the Philosopher's Stone, or when I stuck up for Fleur when everyone else was being a bit... harsh, I suppose. I reckon I'm a loyal friend, and I'll always be there for the people I care about, no matter what.

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: To be honest, I don't always do things the most efficiently. I mean, I like to think on me feet and come up with quick solutions, but sometimes that means we're in a bit of a mess! Like that time we were trying to get into Gringotts, and I was worried about leaving the sword behind - I know it sounds daft now, but it was a real concern at the time. Still, I've learned that when it counts, you've got to trust in yourself and your friends to get the job done.

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd say I manage to stay fairly calm in tense situations, even if it's just on the surface. You see, when it comes down to it, I've got a lot to lose – my friends, my family, my whole life. So, I suppose I find a way to keep my wits about me, even when things are going mental. It's not always easy, mind, but I know I've got to be there for Harry and Hermione, no matter what.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Blimey, I don't really fancy work that's routine, to be honest. I mean, it's all right for a bit, but after a while, it gets a bit dull. I'm a lot more comfortable with a challenge, where I can use my brains and a bit of magic to figure things out. It's like when we were fighting against You-Know-Who - every day was different, and we had to be ready for anything. That's the kind of thing that really gets me going.

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: Sociable? Well, I reckon I'm all right at making friends and having a laugh. I mean, I was a bit of a nervous wreck when I first met Harry on the Hogwarts Express, but he just made me feel like I was part of something special, you know? After that, I was hooked - I found that having a friend like Harry made all the difference, even when things got really dark. And it's not just Harry, either - I've got Ginny, Hermione, and the rest of the gang, and we always manage to have a good time, even in the tough times.

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: Blimey, I suppose I've been a bit...short-tempered at times. There have been moments when I've said things I didn't mean, especially when I felt left out or jealous. But I've always tried to make up for it, and I think that's what really matters, isn't it? I mean, it's not about being perfect, it's about being there for the people you care about, and I've always tried to do that.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: You know, I'm not exactly the planning type, but when it comes to protecting Harry and Hermione, I'm all in. I mean, we've been through so much together, and I know I can count on them to have my back, just like I've got theirs. So, I reckon you could say I do make plans, but they're more like... well, more like instinct, really. When it comes down to it, I'll do whatever it takes to keep the people I care about safe.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I get nervous easily. There's always something going on, whether it's Harry getting into trouble or Voldemort on the loose. I mean, it's hard not to worry when you're mates with the Chosen One and all that, but I've learned to just... well, to just be ready, I suppose. Can't let fear get the better of me, or I'll be no good to Harry and Hermione.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: "Blimey, I love thinking on me feet and coming up with ideas, especially when it's with me best mates Harry and Hermione. There's this rush of excitement when we're trying to figure out some dark secret or save the wizarding world. It's like, the more chaotic things get, the more I seem to shine, and that's a pretty cool feeling, if you ask me."

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not exactly the artistic type, if you know what I mean. I've got more of a... let's say, a "practical" side to me. But, I do love making things up with my mates, especially George, you know? We've had some cracking times coming up with new products at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. It's not really art, but it's a way to have a laugh and make magic happen, even if it's not always supposed to.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: "Blimey, I love cooperating with others! I mean, what's the point of being in a group if you're not willing to work together, right? I've been in some right sticky situations with Harry and Hermione, but we always manage to figure it out in the end. And it's not just about solving problems, it's about having each other's backs and knowing you've got friends who'll stick with you no matter what. We've been through thick and thin, and I don't know what I'd do without them."

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I'm easily distracted, if I'm honest. I get caught up in all the excitement, and before I know it, I've forgotten what we were supposed to be doing. It's a bit of a problem, really. I mean, I'm trying to focus on the important stuff, like helping Harry and Hermione, but it's hard when there's so much going on and I'm worried about our mates.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: Blimey, art, music, and literature aren't exactly my strong points, but I've had me share of adventures that've taught me a thing or two. Like that time I met Hermione on the train, I thought she was a bit too full of herself, but she's turned out to be one of me best mates. As for the rest, I've had me chance to learn a bit about defensive magic, and I've even tried me hand at crafting a few... unusual things with George at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes.
